VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

title: Lead I - DevOps Engineering
desc:
Job Description

Role Proficiency:

Act under guidance of Lead II/Architect understands customer requirements and translate them into design of new DevOps (CI/CD) components. Capable of managing at least 1 Agile Team

Outcomes
 Interprets the DevOps Tool/feature/component design to develop/support the same in accordance with specifications  Adapts existing DevOps solutions and creates own DevOps solutions for new contexts Codes debugs tests documents and communicates DevOps development stages/status of DevOps develop/support issues  Select appropriate technical options for development such as reusing improving or reconfiguration of existing components Optimises efficiency cost and quality of DevOps process tools and technology development Validates results with user representatives; integrates and commissions the overall solution Helps Engineers troubleshoot issues that are novel/complex and are not covered by SOPs Design install configure troubleshoot CI/CD pipelines and software Able to automate infrastructure provisioning on cloud/in-premises with the guidance of architects Provides guidance to DevOps Engineers so that they can support existing components Work with diverse teams with Agile methodologies Facilitate saving measures through automation Mentors A1 and A2 resources  Involved in the Code Review of the team
Measures Of Outcomes
 Quality of deliverables Error rate/completion rate at various stages of SDLC/PDLC # of components/reused # of domain/technology certification/ product certification obtained SLA for onboarding and supporting users and tickets
Outputs Expected

Automated components :
Deliver components that automat parts to install components/configure of software/tools in on premises and on cloudDeliver components that automate parts of the build/deploy for applications
Configured Components
Configure a CI/CD pipeline that can be used by application development/support teams
Scripts
Develop/Support scripts (like Powershell/Shell/Python scripts) that automate installation/configuration/build/deployment tasks
Onboard Users
Onboard and extend existing tools to new app dev/support teams
Mentoring
Mentor and provide guidance to peers
Stakeholder Management
Guide the team in preparing status updates
keeping management updated about the status

Training/SOPs
Create Training plans/SOPs to help DevOps Engineers with DevOps activities and in onboarding users
Measure Process Efficiency/Effectiveness:
Measure and pay attention to efficiency/effectiveness of current process and make changes to make them more efficiently and effectively
Stakeholder Management
Share the status report with higher stakeholder
Skill Examples
 Experience in the design installation configuration and troubleshooting of CI/CD pipelines and software using Jenkins/Bamboo/Ansible/Puppet /Chef/PowerShell /Docker/Kubernetes Experience in Integrating with code quality/test analysis tools like Sonarqube/Cobertura/Clover Experience in Integrating build/deploy pipelines with test automation tools like Selenium/Junit/NUnit Experience in Scripting skills (Python/Linux/Shell/Perl/Groovy/PowerShell) Experience in Infrastructure automation skill (ansible/puppet/Chef/Powershell) Experience in repository Management/Migration Automation – GIT/BitBucket/GitHub/Clearcase Experience in build automation scripts – Maven/Ant Experience in Artefact repository management – Nexus/Artifactory Experience in Dashboard Management & Automation- ELK/Splunk Experience in configuration of cloud infrastructure (AWS/Azure/Google) Experience in Migration of applications from on-premises to cloud infrastructures Experience in Working on Azure DevOps/ARM (Azure Resource Manager)/DSC (Desired State Configuration)/Strong debugging skill in C#/C Sharp and Dotnet Setting and Managing Jira projects and Git/Bitbucket repositories Skilled in containerization tools like Docker/Kubernetes
Knowledge Examples
 Knowledge of Installation/Config/Build/Deploy processes and tools  Knowledge of IAAS - Cloud providers (AWS/Azure/Google etc.) and their tool sets Knowledge of the application development lifecycle Knowledge of Quality Assurance processes Knowledge of Quality Automation processes and tools Knowledge of multiple tool stacks not just one Knowledge of Build Branching/Merging Knowledge about containerization Knowledge on security policies and tools Knowledge of Agile methodologies
Additional Comments
 Create a lab reservation tool using the Sharepoint platform. Have a catalog of labs which can easily be updated using standard Sharepoint tools. An entry in the catalog describes a hardware or VM solution which the user can connect to. Have UI page with the ability to search the catalog for labs based on multiple fields in the catalog. Have UI page with the ability to reserve the lab now, or at any point in the future. Lab Reservations will have a max time limit & will automatically expire 9defined in the lab catalog entry) The user who made the reservation can manually cancel / expire a reservation at any time. The reservation must connect to VMWare VLP REST API to also create/modify/release the reservation in VLP. The user interface must be clean, modern & easy to use. Detailed system requirements will be provided. Demo of similar booking tool UI/UX will be provided. Simple & fast Sharepoint development is required.

Job Description
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
At Boeing, we are all innovators on a mission to connect, protect, explore and inspire. From the seabed to outer space, you’ll learn and grow, contributing to work that shapes the world. Find your future with us.
Boeing India Engineering is currently looking for Associate Database Patching and Service Account Maintenance  to join their team in Bangalore, India.
Boeing is the world’s largest aerospace company and a leading provider of commercial airplanes, defense, space, and security systems, and global services. Building on a legacy of over a century of innovation and leadership, Boeing continues to lead the way in technology and innovation, customer delivery, and investment in its people and future growth of aerospace.
Technology for today and tomorrow
The Boeing India Engineering & Technology Center (BIETC) is a 3000+ diverse engineering workforce that contributes to global aerospace growth. Our engineers deliver cutting-edge R&D, innovation, and high-quality engineering work in global markets, and leverage new-age technologies such as AI/ML, IIoT, Cloud, Model-Based Engineering, and Additive Manufacturing, shaping the future of aerospace.
People-driven culture
At Boeing, we believe creativity and innovation thrives when every employee is trusted, empowered, and has the flexibility to choose, grow, learn, and explore. We offer variable arrangements depending upon business and customer needs, and professional pursuits that offer greater flexibility in the way our people work. We also believe that collaboration, frequent team engagements, and face-to-face meetings bring diverse perspectives and thoughts – enabling every voice to be heard and every perspective to be respected. No matter where or how our teammates work, we are committed to positively shaping people’s careers and being thoughtful about employee wellbeing.
At Boeing, we are inclusive, diverse, and transformative.
With us, you can create and contribute to what matters most in your career, community, country, and world. Join us in powering the progress of global aerospace.
The successful candidate will enjoy working in a fast paced, team-oriented environment, while working creatively in all phases of the software development life cycle.

Own the “Database Patch” metric on the IT Compliance Dashboard that is driven by Database Patching and Upgrades.Ensure SQL Server, Oracle and HANA databases have the latest database supported versions installedWork with Application Architects to obtain Boeing database version roadmapsAssist in developing database upgrade plans to keep all assets in compliancePartner with Database Administrators to ensure database security patches are installedCommunicate database upgrade plans to affected application teamsEnsure application teams perform functional checkout post database upgrade or patch implementationTrack & mitigate risks that may prevent implementation of latest database patch and/or version

May need to work with Vendors to obtain the DB fixesWill need troubleshooting skills to understanding any DB related issues and fix them.Will need to be flexible in work timings. Relocation:
This position offers relocation within India
Export Control Requirements: Not an export control position

desc:
Your work days are brighter here.
At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.
About The Team
The Business Technology Go-To-Market team works in close partnership with our business partners to help fuel growth and revenue goals for Workday, along with driving exceptional Customer and employee experiences. The team is responsible for developing and supporting innovative business and technical led solutions for our Marketing, Sales, Services, Digital, Customer Support & Legal business functions with Salesforce being the primary platform alongside other cutting edge platforms like SnapLogic, CPQ - Conga/Apttus, Reltio, Heroku, CLM, AWS, OKTA (SSO) and other.
About The Role
Come be a part of something big.
Workday is embarking on our next growth adventure. As our Business Technology team continues its mission to deliver unparalleled value to our business partners and customers, we are expanding our presence in the Asia-Pacific region with a new Business Technology office in Pune, India. This new office will be an essential development center to propel the growth of our company through transformational programs for Go-To-Market and Enterprise Data Analytics teams. If you want to be a part of building something big that will drive value throughout the entire global organization, then this is the opportunity for you. You will be working on top priority initiatives that span new and existing technologies - all to deliver outstanding results and experiences for our Customers and employees.
About Go-To-Market Team:
The Business Technology Go-To-Market team works in close partnership with our business partners to help fuel growth and revenue goals for Workday, along with driving exceptional Customer and employee experiences. The team is responsible for developing and supporting innovative architecture-led solutions for our Marketing, Sales, Services, Customer Support & Legal business functions with Salesforce being the primary platform alongside other cutting edge platforms like SnapLogic for Integrations, Conga/Apttus for CPQ, CLM, AWS as PaaS, Coveo Search Platform, OKTA for SSO and others
Our Go-To-Market (GTM) Implement/Enable (Services) is currently looking for a Manager, Information Systems Software Application Development to build and lead a team focused on the design and development of solutions on the Salesforce.com platform.
About You
Primary responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Lead complex projects related to GTM initiatives, sales productivity, user experience and be accountable for timely delivery of projects.Manage and deliver small and large projects by developing the project team, assessing engagement risks throughout, driving conclusions, and reviewing / challenging the output produced by the teamLead the design and development of solutions on the Salesforce.com platform, using Lightning (Aura, LWC), Apex VisualforceLeading the development of solutions that will leverage HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AJAX, and other technologiesSupervise staff to build out Salesforce Projects – responsibilities include identifying, designing, and implementing creative business solutions using OOTB functionalitiesIdentify complex problems and create/suggest solutions to resolve themLead the integration of Salesforce with other toolsManage, advise and mentor team on professional development, general best practices and business initiatives or goals
Basic Qualifications:
Full software development life cycle implementation experienceHands on experience and understanding with Salesforce configurations, Visualforce, Apex, Java, AJAX, .Net, HTML, XML, SQL, CSS, and REST-based web servicesMinimum 7 yrs. Experience on the Platform. 7+ years of hands-on Salesforce experience with evidence of exceptional ability to lead the teamAt least 4 years managing an application development team, with at least 12 years of experience in application developmentExperience implementing Salesforce AppExchange product2 years’ experience developing with Lightning, OR an SPA framework such as React, Angular, or KnockoutKnowledge of Front End skills with jQuery / Bootstrap / AngularJSExperience with development using EclipseExperience developing for Salesforce Communities and Lightning App BuilderExperience on an Agile Scrum project delivered under Continuous Delivery / DevOps
Other Qualifications:
Salesforce Platform App Builder Certification PreferredSalesforce Platform Developer Certification PreferredAbility to present ideas in user-friendly language to non-technical staff and end users.Critical thinker with solid deductive reasoning skillsHighly self-motivated and directed.Team-oriented and skilled in working within a collaborative environment.Ability to work in a fast paced environment meeting the needs of a global business
Our Approach to Flexible Work
With Flex Work, we’re combining the best of both worlds: in-person time and remote. Our approach enables our teams to deepen connections, maintain a strong community, and do their best work. We know that flexibility can take shape in many ways, so rather than a number of required days in-office each week, we simply spend at least half (50%) of our time each quarter in the office or in the field with our customers, prospects, and partners (depending on role). This means you'll have the freedom to create a flexible schedule that caters to your business, team, and personal needs, while being intentional to make the most of time spent together. Those in our remote "home office" roles also have the opportunity to come together in our offices for important moments that matter.
Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Workday about our Employee Referral process!

desc:
As passionate about our people as we are about our mission.
What We’re All About
Q2 is proud of delivering our mobile banking platform and technology solutions, globally, to more than 22 million end users across our 1,300 financial institutions and fintech clients. At Q2, our mission is simple: Build strong, diverse communities by strengthening their financial institutions. We accomplish that by investing in the communities where both our customers and employees serve and live.
What Makes Q2 Special?
Being as passionate about our people as we are about our mission. We celebrate our employees in many ways, including our “Circle of Awesomeness” award ceremony and day of employee celebration among others! We invest in the growth and development of our team members through ongoing learning opportunities, mentorship programs, internal mobility, and meaningful leadership relationships. We also know that nothing builds trust and collaboration like having fun. We hold an annual Dodgeball for Charity event at our Q2 Stadium in Austin, inviting other local companies to play, and community organizations we support to raise money and awareness together.
Responsibilities
Work with developers, business analysts, project managers and other stakeholders to understand the goals and deliverables of each project and how it relates to our industry and our product’s standard functionality.Execute automated test cases and provide results and create resulting defects with diagnostic information for proper triage Create, manage, execute, and maintain automation test scripts Help author, review, and critique Python unit tests and other test scripts.Setup and maintain test environments and test automation.Work with developers to explain test outcomes and guide them to understanding exit criteria.Ability to focus on detail while also exercising pragmatism to keep up with project deadlinesParticipate in and contribute test effort estimates in Sprint/Release planning sessions Be passionate about driving product quality throughout the product line Mentor other test engineers in the practice of test automation

Health & Wellness
Hybrid & Remote Work Opportunities Flexible Time OffCareer Development & Mentoring ProgramsGenerous Retirement Benefit Plans, including a company-matching HSA program.Health & Wellness Benefits, including a 12-weeks of parental leave for eligible new parentsCommunity Volunteering & Company Philanthropy ProgramsEmployee Peer Recognition Programs – “You Earned it”
How We Give Back To The Community
You can learn more about our Q2 Spark Program, Q2 Philanthropy fund, and our employee volunteering programs on our Q2 Community page. Q2 supports dozens of wide-reaching organizations, such as the African American Leadership Institute, Code2College, and YearUp, promoting diversity and success in leadership and technology. Other deserving beneficiaries include Resource Center helping LGBTQ communities, JDRF, and Homes for our Troops, a group helping veterans rebuild their lives with specially adapted homes.
At Q2, our goal is to be a diverse and inclusive workforce that fosters mutual respect for our employees and the communities we serve. title: Senior Data Engineer - Video Processing and AI/ML Specialist
desc:
About us:
Working at Tech Holding isn't just a job, it's an opportunity to be a part of something bigger. We are a full-service consulting firm that was founded on the premise of delivering predictable outcomes and high-quality solutions to our clients. Our founders and team members have industry experience and have held senior positions in a wide variety of companies – from emerging startups to large Fortune 50 firms – and we have taken our combined experiences and developed a unique approach that is supported by the principles of deep expertise, integrity, transparency, and dependability.
The Role:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Engineer with expertise in AWS EMR, Python or Java, and Spark, who specializes in video processing and possesses a deep understanding of AI/ML techniques. In this role, you will be responsible for ingesting and processing vast volumes of video data, leveraging advanced image/video recognition technologies, and creating custom models to identify targeted elements within videos to optimize advertising opportunities. As a key member of our team, you will play a critical role in designing and implementing solutions that enable our clients to unlock the untapped potential of their video data.
What you will do:
Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines and workflows for ingesting, processing, and analysing large-scale video data using AWS EMR, Python/Java, and Spark Utilize advanced image/video recognition techniques to extract relevant information from video content, going beyond out-of-the-box AI solutions. Create and deploy custom AI/ML models to identify and classify specific elements, objects, or events within videos, aligning with advertising opportunities Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists and software engineers, to integrate video processing capabilities into end-to-end data solutions Optimize and scale video processing workflows to handle large volumes of data, ensuring efficiency, reliability, and high-performance processing Stay up to date with the latest advancements in video processing, AI/ML, and relevant technologies, and recommend innovative solutions to enhance our capabilities
Required Skills: 
Strong experience in AWS EMR, Python/Java, and Spark for data engineering and processing tasks at scale In-depth knowledge of AI/ML techniques and frameworks, including custom model development and training Demonstrated expertise in video processing, including familiarity with video formats, codecs, and video-specific data engineering challenges Proficiency in implementing image/video recognition algorithms and techniques beyond standard AI offerings Solid understanding of advertising principles and the ability to identify and extract relevant elements from video content for advertising opportunities Experience with data pipeline orchestration tools (e.g., Apache Airflow) and distributed computing frameworks Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently and within a collaborative team environment Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with stakeholders and present complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences 
Nice to have Skills:
Experience with containerisation technologies, such as Docker and Kubernetes Knowledge of deep learning frameworks, such as TensorFlow or PyTorch Previous exposure to video analytics, computer vision, or natural language processing is a plus.

Position Summary:Cybersecurity Senior Developer - Connectivity will play a pivotal role in shaping the implementation of new Telematics Control Unit (TCU) platforms at Stellantis. In this role, you will implement software solutions for meeting Stellantis cybersecurity and feature requirements working closely with Tier 1 suppliers and SoC provider.


Key Responsibilities:The key responsibilities include:● Cybersecurity implementation and reviews of deliverables from extended team● Guide Hardware and software supplier teams with security implementations for the NAD (Network Access Device) and MCU (Micro Controller)● Remediate threats coming from the TARA and on an ongoing basis● Support cybersecurity validations and reviews● Penetration testing support and remediations● Work with Stellantis PKI and ICT folks for supplier and product integration● Enforce secure coding practices and monitor security scan reports

Basic Qualifications:● University degree in the field of computer science, Cybersecurity, Information systems, or software engineering with minimum of 3 years related work experience● Experience with native software engineering stacks (C/C++)● Experience in software development on Linux-like systems with cybersecurity responsibility● Secure boot principles, authenticated firmware● HSM, Secure Execution Environment● Cryptography, PKI, Message authentication● Ability to work both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.

Preferred Qualifications● Protection Profiles, Common Criteria● Knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws.● Regulatory requirements - eCall, Firmware updates, CSMS (UNECE R.155, R156)● Threat Assessment Risk Analysis (TARA)● Understanding of signal, API and service-oriented interface design● Excellent understanding of coding methods and best practices.● Knowledge of SAFe Agile practices


At Stellantis, we assess candidates based on qualifications, merit and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, age, ethnicity, nationality, religion, sexual orientation and disability. Diverse teams will allow us to better meet the evolving needs of our customers and care for our future.By submitting your application, you are accepting our privacy notice: https://www.stellantis.com/en/privacy
Regards,TA

title: Security Operations Analyst
desc:
What we're looking for:
You are a security analyst that has experience within a 24x7 environment with both cloud and enterprise experience, working hand-in-hand with all relevant stakeholders to identify, investigate and remediate potential related threats. You work across multiple networks, applications, vendors, cloud providers, and technology stacks to support an effective Cybersecurity Operations organisation
You participate in a team of Cybersecurity Managers, Engineers, Analysts and SREs on day-to-day duties as well as work with leadership team on strategic initiatives, providing hands-on technical expertise to assist with creating new methods for detection and triage and have the ability to assist with helping analyse potentially new capabilities.
Shift timings: 4x10 shift on Wed, Thur, Fri, Sat from 05:00 IST - 15:00 IST
Work location: In-office, Bangalore (Prestige Dynasty or Embassy Golf Links)
Position Overview
As a Security Operations Center (SOC) analyst, you will play a critical role in our cyber security function to ensure enterprise and client data is secure and private. You will help provide 24x7 monitoring for CSG by acting as the first line of defence against potentially malicious events. Escalate confirmed incidents to a variety of internal and external teams. Assist in developing use cases, onboarding, and driving log requirements to further detection capabilities. Develop response playbooks for multiple scenarios. Assist with change management oversight. Help drive technical service improvements to meet strategic security goals. Work with internal and external teams within security and the enterprise to drive cyber security remediation efforts.
Role Requirements
Experience with security processes and technologies
Awareness about various frameworks, standard controls and benchmarks like Cyber Kill Chain, MITRE ATT&CK, CIS, etc.
Experience with endpoint security technologies like MDE, Crowdstrike Falcon.
Hands-on knowledge of malware investigation and eradication.
Experience with email phishing analysis and remediation.
Experience and open to shift work in operations centre environments
Experienced with data analysis, centralised logging (Splunk, ELK, etc.);
Demonstrable experience in AWS and Azure
Assess, design, and improve SOC processes and workflows with a focus on integrating automation through Security Orchestration, Automation and Response (SOAR) tools and technologies.
Experience investigating information security incidents
Familiarity with security engineering and operations practices
Demonstrated hands-on experience with AWS Cloud Security Services and Practices.
Demonstrated hand-on experience with Azure Identity and Access Management.
Familiarity with industry benchmarks and certifications such as CIS, SOC2, FedRAMP, etc
Demonstrable capability to develop use cases or additional detection capabilities
Basic Qualifications
Bachelors degree in cybersecurity, related field, or equivalent work experience
Nice to have
Working knowledge of Python, PowerShell, and Bash
Experience with sandboxing and malware analysis
Incident Response experience
Sec+, GSEC, CEH or similar certifications
You are willing to work in morning, night or afternoon shifts if needed to be.
About Cloud Software Group
Cloud Software Group combines the capabilities of both Citrix and TIBCO, creating one of the worlds largest cloud software providers, serving more than 100 million users around the globe. When you join Cloud Software Group, you are making a difference for real people, each of whom count on our suite of cloud solutions to get work done from anywhere. Members of our team will tell you that we value diverse lived experiences, varied perspectives, and having the courage to take risks. Our teams are encouraged to learn, dream, and build the future of work. We are on the brink of another Cambrian leap - a moment of immense evolution and growth. And we need your expertise and experience to do it. Now is the perfect time to move your skills to the cloud
Cloud Software Group is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination on the basis of age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, ethnicity, national origin, citizenship, religion, genetic carrier status, disability, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, marital status, protected veteran status, and other protected classifications.

desc:
Job Description

Job Purpose

ICE Mortgage Technology® is driving value to every customer through our effort to automate everything that can be automated in the residential mortgage industry. Our integrated solutions touch each aspect of the loan lifecycle, from the borrower's "point of thought" through e-Close and secondary solutions. Drive real automation that reduces manual workflows, increases productivity, and decreases risk.

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be part of a team responsible for the design, implementation, and support of the ICE AIQ Platform. This position also offers a unique opportunity for both server-side and front-end development, with an emphasis on server-side.

The ideal candidate should possess a product mentality, have a strong sense of ownership, and strive to be a good steward of his or her software. More than any concrete experience with specific technology, it is critical for the candidate to have a strong sense of what constitutes good software; be thoughtful and deliberate in picking the right technology stack; and be always open-minded to learn (from others and from failures). This role requires frequent interactions with fellow developers, project and product managers, quality assurance, and other stakeholders, to ensure delivery of world-class applications to our users.

Responsibilities
An Agile developer, focusing on sustainable development by exercising good estimation, effective branching strategies for managing code, automated testing to protect quality, and continuous deployment to get fast feedback from users Drive/Actively participate in design discussions around architecture and business requirements with Architects, Product Owners, and Business Owners. Own an undefined/ unbounded problem and drive the team towards a scalable design & solution. Provide recommendations for continuous improvement, across product, architecture, and implementation Prepare detailed design document including Class diagram, sequence diagram, interface specification, persistence model, screen mockups where required Collaborate cross-functionally with Technical Owners, Product managers and other engineers to achieve elegant solutions Lead in developing architecture/solution prototypes and technology evaluation Implement modules ensuring best coding practice Perform code reviews of components & modules with recommendation around best coding practices Resolving technical issues of the Product implementation Assist Operations / Support team in resolving Production Issues Provide technical guidance to young smart Software Engineers 
Knowledge And Experience
Degree in Computer Science or equivalent 5+ years’ experience as software engineer or equivalent Development experience in building and deploying web-based product, software design and development in a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) Expertise in responsive web design, cross-browsers compatibility and DevOps environment and working with CI/CD methodologies (Must Have) Proficiency with JavaScript and HTML5, CSS3 (Must Have) Deep knowledge of React JS /Angular frameworks, best practices and commonly used modules based on extensive work experience (Must Have) Good knowledge of Java (Must Have) Good knowledge of implementing and testing REST Web Services (Must Have) Experience creating self-contained, reusable, and testable modules and components Good knowledge of Unit testing tools such as Mockito, karma, jasmine (Nice to Have) Know-how of cucumber, selenium etc. (Nice to Have) Experience working on distributed Architecture such as SOA/Microservices (Must Have) Experience working with agile methodologies, BDD, TDD, Scrum (Must Have) Familiarity working with project tracking systems, such as Jira, Confluence, SVN or GIT repository and continuous integration environments (Hudson/Jenkins etc.) (Must Have) Demonstrated ability to set priorities and work in a fast-paced, dynamic team environment within a start-up culture. Disciplined approach in testing, test coverage, quality assurance and other software development best practices 
Schedule

This role offers work from home flexibility of up to 2 days per week.

desc:
About Us
With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world’s leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.
Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.
At ChargePoint, we foster a positive and productive work environment by committing to live our values of Be Courageous, Charge Together, Love our Customers, Operate with Openness, and Relentlessly Pursue Awesome. These values guide how we show up every day, align, and work together to build a brighter future for all of us.
Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.
Discover what it’s like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.

Director, Technical Support

What You Will Bring to ChargePoint
Tenacious commitment to customer-focused supportComfort with making complex decisions and excited by "thinking outside the box"Proven experience in driving initiatives, cross-functional collaborations, and holding others accountable to expectationsProcess and people management skillsMaintains effectiveness when experiencing major changes in personal work tasks or work environment; adjusts effectively to work within new work structures, processes, requirements, or culturesDeals effectively with others in antagonistic situations, using appropriate interpersonal styles and methods to reduce tension or conflict while dealing with various teams or departments.Actively appreciates and includes the diverse capabilities, insights, and ideas of others and working effectively and respectfully with individuals of diverse backgrounds, styles, abilities, and motivationSets high standards of performance for self; assuming responsibility and accountability for successfully completing assignments or tasks; self-imposing standards of excellence rather than having standards imposed

desc:
Company Description
For over 15 years, Zscaler has been disrupting and transforming the security industry. Our 100% purpose-built cloud platform delivers the entire gateway security stack as a service through 150 global datacentres to securely connect users to their applications, regardless of device, location, or network in over 185 countries protecting over 3,900 companies and have detected 100 Million threats/day.
We work in a fast-paced, dynamic, and make it happen culture. Our people are some of the brightest and passionate in the industry that thrives on being the first to solve problems. We are always looking to hire highly passionate, collaborative, and humble people that want to make a difference.
Job Description
Location: Mohali / Bangalore / Hyderabad / Pune , India 
The Mobile team at Zscaler is responsible for developing a cross-platform client application for Windows, MacOS, Android, IOS and Linux, to securely steer endpoint traffic to Zscaler cloud. You will be the MS Windows programming domain expert on this team and bring your endpoint software development experience to the team. You will ideally have worked on a VPN client or like client application and understand the intricacies of multi-version multi-platform client apps. This is a technical leadership position, you will be involved in all aspects of product development lifecycle – requirements discussion/analysis, design, scope estimation, planning, implementation, code reviews and unit testing, documentation, POCs, deployment and continuing engineering.
Primary Responsibility
Work with Product Management to understand requirements and customer needs.Design and Development of multi-platform software using latest software development techniques.Design and implement features that enhance the reliability and quality of our software products.Monitor and analyze software performance data to identify and address issues related to reliability and quality.Develop and execute automated tests to validate software functionality and reliability.Work with QA to create better test strategies, reproduce customer issues and deliver better quality product releases.
Qualifications
5+ years software engineering experience, with emphasis in C/C++ / Java networking-based applications on Windows, Mac, IOS, Android or Linux Operating SystemsUnderstanding of Layer 3 and higher networking technologies - IP/TCP/HTTP/SSL protocolsHands on experience with one or more object-oriented languages such as C++/C#/JavaStrong Understanding of high performing data structures and algorithmsExperience in designing, developing, and debugging complex software applications.Knowledge on tools like Visual Studio, XCode, IntelliJ, WinDBG, Wireshark, fiddlerExposure to networking domain and proxies is an added advantage.Experience with automated testing frameworks and tools.Experience with software performance measurement toolsExcellent oral and written communication skills
Desired Skills
Good understanding of one or more operating systems: Mac, Android, iOS, linux is desired.Good understanding of security concepts such as PKI, VPN and firewallGood understanding of network security technologies
Education Requirements
Bachelor’s in computer science or related field is required
Additional Information
Why Zscaler?
People who excel at Zscaler are smart, motivated and share our values. Ask yourself: Do you want to team with the best talent in the industry? Do you want to work on disruptive technology? Do you thrive in a fluid work environment? Do you appreciate a company culture that enables individual and group success and celebrates achievement? If you said yes, we’d love to talk to you about joining our award-winning team.
Additional information about Zscaler (NASDAQ: ZS ) is available at https://www.zscaler.com.
Zscaler is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
Zscaler is committed to providing reasonable support (called accommodations or adjustments) in our recruiting processes for candidates who are differently abled, have long term conditions, mental health conditions or sincerely held religious beliefs, or who are neurodivergent or require pregnancy-related support. If you need support, please contact us by sending an email to accommodations@zscaler.com. This email address is used specifically for accommodation requests only, and resumes, CV's, or questions other than accommodations will not be replied to or accepted.

Description
Description
UKG is looking to hire a Engineering Manager for one of our HRSD Team. You will work within a global and distributed team to develop quality software aligned with product and company objectives; and take part in building one of our next generation platform products.
The Engineering Manager will provide Leadership to teams for one of our product HRSD, working on developing, maintaining software to enhance and support the engineering activities.
The Engineering Manager will be responsible for the direct management of Software Engineers to learn, develop, integrate new features and maintain our product.
Our Leadership principles are trust in the foundation of successful relationships, we expect our engineering manager to collaborate closely with all stakeholders including direct teams and operate at all levels. Engineering manager ownership including owning team deliverables as per organization business objectives and fostering an environment deliver faster value to our clients.
You will be a key collaborator, leader, and influencer within UKG engineering culture, improving product and process equally to increase customer satisfaction.

Here at UKG, our purpose is people™. Our HR, payroll, and workforce management solutions help organizations unlock happier outcomes for all. title: Lead Service Engineer
desc:
Organization background 

We are a group of professionals who work towards enabling decisions that improve patient and caregiver experience. Now, as we face a new frontier—a changing health care landscape - we are looking for pioneering and compassionate individuals to plan for the next century and who can work on re-imagining the future of care with cutting-edge technologies such as big data, machine learning, artificial intelligence, IoT, and blockchain that enhance patient outcomes and experiences and more importantly, drive a lasting social impact .

 What will you be responsible for? 
 As Service Engineer you would be responsible for complete ownership of Own the service design maturity of the components from E2E perspective covering the DevOps, deployment pipelines, monitoring of production, resiliency, performance, high availability, and reliability  Maintaining the Infrastructure, Security, Patching, Compliance, Governance on the components of ownership.  Provide SE thought leadership from Service Design Maturity perspective into the platform roadmap, feature delivery, accountability for application architecture, Cloud design, Infrastructures development and end to end implementation.  Own the platform environments and identify opportunities to evolve towards ZDD, One Click Deploy, Security implementations and end to end automations to eliminate manual toil.  Participate in Conducting and Maintain periodic DR exercises for the Product and Platform and ensuring System Resiliency, HA and confidence in Product Stability in Production

 Closely work with team on the delivery, roadmap execution while continuously looking to evolve the Service Maturity of the product.  Understand the business and define what is technically needed to meet strategic objectives and the day-to-day running of the service. This includes identification and innovation of new service capabilities that meets customer and security requirements.  Identify service improvements and develop and design tools that will streamline the service to improve end-user experiences and lower operating costs.  Partner with Software Engineering, Security Architects and Product Management team for Quality of Service.  Ensure production solutions are reliable, resilient, secure, and effective and that implemented solutions are continuously monitored and documented.  Partner with Global Engineering teams on shared goals and focus on the outcomes with a collaborative mindset.  Actively take part in disaster recovery drills and in improving methods.  Who are we looking for?

Knowledge in administration, installation and debugging App services, SQL Server (On prem or on Azure), Kubernetes, Service Fabric, Containers  Strong Knowledge to SQL (On-Pre and Azure) , Power BI , Databricks , Ability to write SQL queries, with knowledge of RDBMS concepts.  Strong communication and collaboration skills: with the ability to grasp complex concepts and the ability to explain them effectively.  Critical thinking skills to understand a current problem and Problem management skill on repetitive issues with recommendations which could incorporate effective problem management techniques. 

Providence is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

We appreciate differences related to the factors including but not limited to background, education, gender, age, generation, religious background, ability, technical skills in all our employment related opportunities.

title: Technical Product Owner
desc:
Rockwell Automation is a global technology leader focused on helping the world’s manufacturers be more productive, sustainable, and agile. With more than 28,000 employees who make the world better every day, we know we have something special. Behind our customers - amazing companies that help feed the world, provide life-saving medicine on a global scale, and focus on clean water and green mobility - our people are energized problem solvers that take pride in how the work we do changes the world for the better.
We welcome all makers, forward thinkers, and problem solvers who are looking for a place to do their best work. And if that’s you we would love to have you join us!
Job Description
The Technical Product Owner performs the necessary leadership, analysis, and design tasks related to the development of effective solution architectures at Rockwell Automation. The TPO is responsible for high level engineering solution design often working with technology partners through understanding of organizational and business needs and ensuring fit with architectural standards, best practices and roadmap.
This leader will also identify and standardize platforms components, define and refine processes, and tools to meet organizational needs and business objectives. The TPO will participate in all phases of the technology delivery lifecycle for related projects and initiatives, while continuously seeking ways to refine and enhance the implementation methodologies. The successful candidate will possess a broad range of technical experience, coupled with strong analytical capabilities, and excellent interpersonal, communication, facilitation skills, and business acumen.
The TPO will work in collaboration with development teams and other technical lead resources creates POCs, defines and communicates best practices, approach and direction for the technical aspects of our cloud-based business applications and solutions. This role partners with software leadership is to assist in establishing a technical vision and works closely with delivery teams to ensure adherence to vision and guidelines during implementation. The TPO will work to define technical requirements and work with supporting teams to ensure that commercial terms are appropriate as well.
We are looking for a talented, passionate and experienced Technical Product Owner (TPO) to drive product features and grow the business in a fast-paced, agile environment. The TPO should be hands-on, as well as have the ability to lead a small and energetic team on a project basis.
The TPO participates in the entire product lifecycle, working across development, business units, sales, marketing and sales enablement functions, including supporting the creation of any collateral that is needed for these activities. The position requires a strong presence at industry and partner events

desc:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, gt.school. Have you got what it takes?
Are you a Software Architect with an unwavering commitment to well-engineered code who thrives in the fast-paced world of AWS cloud computing? Do you relish the challenge of leading product development, crafting, and executing complex architectural decisions? If you're driven by a passion for pushing the boundaries of what's possible in tech, then GT School is looking for you!
At GT School, we're not just developing software; we're revolutionizing education. Our groundbreaking data platform, CoachBot, empowers students to learn independently, with no teacher or tutor required. Through tight integration with numerous learning apps, CoachBot harnesses the power of analytics to assess student performance, delivering targeted real-time feedback and encouraging progress with innovative motivational techniques - including cash rewards!
What sets us apart? Our platform is 100% cloud-native, utilizing cutting-edge AWS technologies like Lambda, Step Functions, Glue, AppSync, and QuickSight. This means you'll spend less time maintaining old code and more time pioneering new solutions in a dynamic, ever-evolving tech landscape.
We believe that technical leadership shouldn't mean "graduating" to administration and management - here, you'll always be at the cutting edge, driving the design and development of new features. As our Principal Software Architect, you'll lead by example, delivering the most complex features and making the most challenging architectural decisions. You'll have the opportunity to inspire and shape a team of talented engineers, all while remaining hands-on and engaged with the technology you love.
If you're a strategic thinker with a proven track record in software architecture and cloud technologies, and you're ready to redefine the future of education, we'd love to hear from you!
What You Will Be Doing
Making the most complex architectural decisions in the productReviewing feature design proposals from other team members and simplifying themReviewing the code of other team members for simplicity and correctnessStandardizing best practices into playbooks to improve the quality of the whole team
Technical Team Lead Key Responsibilities

desc:
Years of Experience – 6-9 years

Position summary

The Managed Services team is responsible for all the infrastructure and automation required to support continuous integration and continuous delivery both for client cloud (UAT and Production) environments and internal environments. This person would work as part of a global team to help manage these environments and ensure that Managed Services requests are actioned within well defined SLAs.

What You'll Do
 Play an integral role in the Managed Services offering providing support and expertise to ensure maximum up-time of environments. Ensure that client SLAs are strictly adhered to and their primary focus will be on continuous performant operations. Be involved in core team tasks including investigating and resolving environment issues, investigating and implementing automated solutions and analyzing and improving existing SCM tool chain applications. Be required to liaise with the other teams in Managed Services to ensure the overall team works together as one. As well as various other groups (e.g. Support, Architecture, IT) to ensure issues are resolved, new tools/trends are analysed, etc. Be familiar with operating in a challenging environment supported from different locations and should also have a strong appreciation of Development processes, tool sets and delivery infrastructure, and be comfortable working with multiple differing systems and tools. Be required to work within a team structure. Demonstrate a willingness to learn new technologies, processes, tool sets and be comfortable working with multiple differing systems.
Duties & Accountabilities
 Manage client cloud environments (UAT and production) Occasional outside support hours will be required as part of an on call rota to provide 24/7 cover Action Managed Services requests within defined SLAs, Optimize processes around Service Requests, resource reclamation, and monitoring. Implement automated solutions for repetitive and manual tasks. Analysis and improvement of existing SCM tool chain applications Collaboration with Managed Services stakeholders to refine and continuously improve deliverables and services according to their requirements. Collaboration with IT / Technical Architecture in R&D to assess tooling and trends. Manage internal environments
What You Need to Get the Job Done
 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related discipline 4-6 years of experience in a similar role Good working knowledge of UNIX/Linux systems and technologies – including shell scripting, OS configuration and troubleshooting Good working knowledge of the Java eco system, JEE applications and application servers e.g. JBoss, Oracle WebLogic, IBM WebSphere Prior experience of Incident Management/Ticketing Systems (e.g. Jira, ServiceNow) and workflows Understanding of cloud computing concepts
Advantageous Skills
 Understanding of messaging oriented middleware especially JMS (e.g. IBM MQ, Active MQ) Working knowledge of AWS Experience of supporting a high uptime/high availability (24x7) system Understanding of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery, concepts and tooling Familiarity with scripting languages (e.g. Python, Groovy, Perl) Familiarity with build automation and dependency management Ability to work within a team containing geographically disparate people Familiarity with source control systems (e.g. SVN, GIT) – branching, hook scripting, access control, backup & recovery SQL and JAVA skills would be an advantage Good working knowledge of software development lifecycle
Personal Attributes
 Strong analytical/troubleshooting skills Excellent written and verbal English Proven ability to collaborate in a team environment Meticulous attention to detail Strong inter-personal skills with practical, can-do approach Proactive work ethic Desire and ability for quick learning of new tools and technologies Proven documentation skills

Come become part of something big with us! We are a global leader, with hubs in North America, South America, Asia Pacific, Europe, and the Middle East.
Job Description
Extreme Networks is searching for a Cloud Backend Engineer to help develop Extreme Cloud SD-WAN & SASE solution. As a member of the team, you will have the opportunity to contribute across the Extreme Cloud SD-WAN & SASE product stack, ranging from cloud-based microservices to on-premises virtual appliances.
Job Responsibilities
You will be part of a high-performing agile scrum team that designs, implements, and tests new features and functionality of Extreme Cloud SD-WAN & SASE. Development will include innovative technologies in the fields of Cloud Management, Cluster, Security, Machine Learning. You will take new features from concept to delivery, working closely with team members and cross-functional partners to design and develop high-quality solutions that take into consideration scalability, availability, and performance. You will also actively participate in design and code reviews for the team.
Qualifications
5+ years of industry experience in software engineering
Solid computer science fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, etc.)
Hands on programming experience in Java, REST APIs, Spring FrameworkXML, REST, JSON
Hands-on programming experience with RabbitMQ, Kafka, Hibernate, Postgres, Distributed Storage (Elasticsearch etc.)
Hands-on experience working on resilient, scalable distributed systems
Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills
Other Desired Qualifications
Experience developing enterprise security/networking products
Experience with cloud architecture and related technologies
Familiarity with SD-WAN, SASE technologies
Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning as it relates to networking
Familiarity with service-oriented architecture and distributed computing
You Will Be a Great Fit If You Are
A quick learner with excellent communication skills
Tenacious in your approach to problem solving
Highly productive with minimal supervision
Eager to learn about and adopt the latest technologies and best practices in your field
Extreme Networks, Inc. ( EXTR ) creates effortless networking experiences that enable all of us to advance. We push the boundaries of technology leveraging the powers of machine learning, artificial intelligence, analytics, and automation. Over 50,000 customers globally trust our end-to-end, cloud-driven networking solutions and rely on our top-rated services and support to accelerate their digital transformation efforts and deliver progress like never before. For more information, visit Extreme's website or follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn, and Facebook.
We encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply. Come Advance with us! In keeping with our values, no employee or applicant will face discrimination/harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination/harassment based on “protected categories,” Extreme Networks also strives to prevent other, subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (e.g., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our organization. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at Extreme Networks.

Tesco Bengaluru: We are a multi-disciplinary team creating a sustainable competitive advantage for Tesco by standardising processes, delivering cost savings, enabling agility, providing cutting-edge technological solutions and empowering our colleagues to do ever more for our customers. Tesco Technology consists of people from a number of different backgrounds, but having a common purpose to serve our shoppers a little better every day with our retail technological solutions. Whether making products, software or systems, our teams focuses on various aspects from taking strategic ownership of the architecture to delivering technological solutions such as design, testing, deployment, infrastructure, operation and security of the systems to ensure agile, smooth and safe operations. These help us to deliver the maximum business impact. Teams refine their internal processes to best fit their own needs, working to build core capabilities in application and services. title: Senior Telco Cloud Specialist
desc:
Senior Telco Cloud Specialist/Telco Cloud Specialist 
Location : Mumbai/Delhi/Bangalore
Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?
The role of a Telco Cloud Specialist at VMware is focused on the centralized business of telecommunications, providing you with the opportunity to work closely with major Telco Operators and their partners in a dynamic and diverse landscape. In this role, you will play a key part in helping these operators achieve their strategic objectives and overcome challenges related to telco core and access business. Your responsibilities will involve collaborating on initiatives that span various aspects of their business, including lines of business, applications, multi-cloud, and digital workplace, with a global reach. By delivering creative and innovative solutions, you will contribute to driving their desired business outcomes.
Moreover, you will have a unique opportunity to support one of the world's leading Telco operators in their virtualization and containerization efforts for mobile networks. This encompasses the core, particularly the 5G Core, as well as the edge and RAN. VMware offers a comprehensive suite of technologies and products, and you will be able to gain knowledge and expertise in these areas. You will also have the chance to present and influence the product roadmap to align with the Telco's strategic vision.
At VMware, we understand the importance of fair compensation for your valuable work. We regularly analyse our compensation structure and compare it with top-tier technology companies globally. As an organization, we are committed to ensuring equitable pay and have established internal processes and monitoring systems to identify and address any potential pay equity issues. In addition to a competitive base salary and the possibility of performance bonuses or commissions, we offer a range of benefits, including an Employee Stock Purchase Program, annual salary reviews, retirement support, and financial contributions to promote your overall well-being.
Success in the Role: What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?
Your aim is to achieve an impactful contribution to your customers’ success by fostering trusted and influential relationships with their senior executives. You will focus on delivering strategic approaches and agreed outcomes with a strong opinion of where VMware’s value aligns to their business direction.
Strong telco virtualization (Automation, Orchestration, Cloud native technology, and so on ) technical knowledge and hands-on skillset are highly requested for this position.
You will be part of a core team working on the account and will have started to navigate within VMware and worked with many of your colleagues, from Sales, Professional Services, Partners’ Management, Product Management, Engineering, etc. You will be identified as a key contributor to this important customer.
This senior role requires a leader that can demonstrate the VMware EPIC2 Values of:
Execution: Do It Together.Passion: Challenge the Status Quo.Integrity: Build Trust.Customers: Make It Possible.Community: Give more.
The Work: What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?
Required Skills:
Proficient in telco solution selling including products, services, and support.Existing experience in VMWare Telco solution technologyProficient experience in selling to large Telco and Service Providers within the APAC and globallyExperience of B2B service creation for selling with/through Telco service providersAbility to collaborate with multiple groups globally to inspire alignment and executionStrong customer-facing and relationship building skills at the executive levelHighly trusted individual who maintains and expects high standards for self and teamConsultative selling skills and business awarenessAbility to see and present “the big picture” and offer solutions to drive business valueConsistent track record of successfully driving multi-millions of sales campaigns of solutions and servicesPrevious experience of selling 4G, 5G, RAN, OSS, BSS solutions to Telco service providers is a major plusResponse for RFP and POC is also a major plus
Telco Solution Engineer is the leader and primary interface to technologists and key decision-makers to our first-tier communication service provider customers. You will be expected to build relationships with technologist in our customers and strategic partners and develop technical solutions for the Radio Access Network (RAN) and/or Mobile Packet Core.
In this capacity you will lead the development, presentation, and positioning of multi-product solutions for customers in the Telco industry and ensure VMware’s roadmap and strategy meets customer requirements. You will also be responsible for being the ‘voice of the customer’ within the VMware product and development teams.
You are a thought leader driving technical and business requirements with large Mobile and Communications Providers. You have worked in the Telco and/or Cloud ecosystem of Vendors and/or Partners to drive end to end strategy for customers.
 This position is part of VMware Future of Work and fully remote. Candidates can be located anywhere in the United States!
Industry Specific Knowledge:
Knowledgeable in 3G/4G and 5G Radio network architecture and ecosystemDetailed understanding of 3GPP packet core domain and specifications as related to 4G EPC and 5G core. Functions: SMF, UPF, AMF, MME, SAEGW, ePDGSubscriber and Policy (PCRF/PCF, AUSF, SDM, HSS, HLR)Knowledgeable in Radio Access Network (RAN) design and RAN virtualization Strong technical knowledge of 3GPP specifications as related to CU and DU and RRU protocol interfacesRAN Technologies (vRAN, Small Cells, MIMO, Timing and Sync with GPS, IEEE 1588v2)Knowledge of O-RAN specs, TIP/OpenRAN projects, and/or ONF SD-RAN.Mobile Private LTE, Small Cell, and Wi-Fi Industry experienceData Center networking, Virtualization, NFV and SDNLayer 1-3 functionalityCloud Native Container orchestration via Kubernetes.MEC and Edge Computing Management and Orchestration (e.g., MANO), Network Management, OSS/BSS, and TM Forum standards
What is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?
You will be part of a team of Global Telco Team, working on the largest Telco accounts. You will have frequent interactions with your Manager and with the core Account team assigned to your customer. However, you will have large autonomy on a daily basis with little formal reporting. You will be expected to share information with the rest of the team and can expect the team to help you when you have questions.
Where is this role located?
Location : Mumbai/Delhi/Bangalore
What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware?
You and your loved ones will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Below are some highlights, or you can view the complete benefits package by visiting www.benefits.vmware.com.
Medical Coverage, Retirement, and Parental Leave Plans for All Family TypesGenerous Time Off Programs40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your communityRethink's Neurodiversity program to support parents raising children with learning or behavior challenges, or developmental disabilitiesFinancial contributions to your ongoing development (conference participation, trainings, course work, etc.)Wellness reimbursement and online fitness and wellbeing classes
Category : Sales
Subcategory: Solutions Architect
Experience: Business Leadership
Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time
Posted Date: 2023-06-13
VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.
Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

title: Senior Software Engineer - Java FullStack

desc:
At Skillsoft, we propel organizations and people to grow together through transformative learning experiences. We believe every team member has the potential to be AMAZING. Join us in our quest to transform learning and help individuals unleash their edge.

Overview

To succeed in this challenging journey, we have set up multiple co-located teams across the globe (Hyderabad, US, Europe), embracing the scaled agile framework, a Micro Services approach combined with the DevOps model. We have passionate engineers working full time on this new platform in Hyderabad and it’s only the beginning. You will get a chance to work with brilliant people and some of the best development and design teams, in addition to working with cutting edge technologies such as React, Java/Node JS, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS.

We are looking for exceptional Java/Node based full stack developers to join our team You will work alongside the Architect and DevOps teams to fully form an autonomous development squad and be in-charge of a part of the product.

Opportunity Highlights
 Designing and developing software Products: You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining software products using a Java, Node.JS, React framework in Microservices architecture hosted on AWS cloud.Collaborating with cross-functional teams: You will work closely with cross-functional teams such as product management, user experience, DevOps and CloudOps teams to deliver high-quality software products.Participating in agile development practices: Skillsoft follows agile development practices, and as a Full Stack Senior Software Engineer, you will be responsible for participating in agile ceremonies such as grooming, stand-ups, sprint planning, and retrospectives.Staying up-to-date with emerging technologies: You will be expected to stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry trends, and apply this knowledge to improve software development practices at Skillsoft.Overall, as a Full Stack Senior Software Engineer at Skillsoft, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining high-quality software product, providing technical leadership to the team, and contributing to the overall success of the company
Skills & Qualifications
 Minimum 6+ years of software engineering development experience developing cloud-based enterprise solutions.Expertise in programming languages (Java, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS)Expertise in JavaScript frameworks (Node.js, React, Redux, Angular, Express.js)Expertise with frameworks (Spring Boot, Stream processing)Expertise in working with REST API, Web services and SAML integrationsExpertise working with databases preferably Postgres.Good knowledge on DevOps (Docker, Kubernetes, Ansible, AWS)Experience with code versioning tools, preferably Git (Github, Gitlab, etc) and the feature branch workflowWorking Experience on Kafka, RabbitMq (messaging queue systems)Knowledge on design principles and design patternsGood problem solving and analytical skills and understanding of various data structures and algorithms.Must know how to code applications on Unix/Linux based systems.Experience with build automation tools like Maven, Gradle, NPM, WebPack, Grunt.Sound troubleshooting skills to address code bugs, performance issues and environment issues that may arise.Good understanding of the common security concerns of high volume publicly exposed systemsExperience in working with Agile/Scrum environment.Strong analytical skills and the ability to understand complexities and how components connect and relate to each other
OUR VALUES

We Embrace Every Opportunity To Serve Our Customers And Each Other As

WE ARE PASSIONATELY COMMITTED TO LEADERSHIP, LEARNING, AND SUCCESS.
ONE TEAMOPEN AND RESPECTFULCURIOUSREADYTRUE
More About Skillsoft

Skillsoft delivers online learning, training, and talent solutions to help organizations unleash their edge. Leveraging immersive, engaging content, Skillsoft enables organizations to unlock the potential in their best assets – their people – and build teams with the skills they need for success. Empowering 36 million learners and counting, Skillsoft democratizes learning through an intelligent learning experience and a customized, learner-centric approach to skills development with resources for Leadership Development, Business Skills, Technology & Development, Digital Transformation, and Compliance.

Skillsoft is partner to thousands of leading global organizations, including many Fortune 500 companies. The company features three award-winning systems that support learning, performance and success: Skillsoft learning content, the Percipio intelligent learning experience platform, which offers measurable impact across the entire employee lifecycle. Learn more at www.skillsoft.com.

If this opportunity intrigues you, we would love for you to apply!

NOTE TO EMPLOYMENT AGENCIES: We value the partnerships we have built with our preferred vendors. Skillsoft does not accept unsolicited resumes from employment agencies. All resumes submitted by employment agencies directly to any Skillsoft employee or hiring manager in any form without a signed Skillsoft Employment Agency Agreement on file and search engagement for that position will be deemed unsolicited in nature. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is subsequently hired as a result of the referral or through other means.

Skillsoft is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer: It is the policy of Skillsoft (US) Corporation to provide equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability (mental or physical), protected veteran status, genetic information or any other class protected by law.
